isis.stitle: FULL POWER HYDRAULIC ABS BRAKE SYSTEM - SYSTEM MAINTENANCE - Parking brake cable RELEASE PROCEDURE

svcproc.title: Parking brake cable RELEASE PROCEDURE

caution.para: While removing the parking brake cable, only the threaded rod should rotate. If the cable is to be reused, do not allow the cable to twist during removal.

svcproc.para: In the event that the parking brake cable must be disconnected to allow the vehicle to be safely towed, perform the following steps. Refer to FIGURE 42 .

step1.para: If the parking brake system is inoperable, disconnect the cable as follows:

step2.para: Install wheel chocks, place the transmission in P, PB or N, and turn the key to OFF.
While using a 15 mm wrench to hold the SAHR canister shaft, loosen the jam nut on the threaded rod with a 16 mm wrench.

While using the 15 mm wrench to hold the canister shaft, unscrew the threaded rod using an 8 mm wrench. The rod must be unscrewed approximately 2.5 inches before the cable disconnects. The cable will exhibit some resistance while being unscrewed because it is under tension.

step1.para: If the parking brake system is operable, disconnect the cable as follows:

step2.para: Install wheel chocks, place the transmission in neutral (N), not P or PB, and turn the key ON.
While pressing the brake pedal, press the dash mounted PARK BRAKE switch to release the parking brake. This will extend the SAHR canister shaft and relieve the tension on the parking brake cable.
While using a 15 mm wrench to hold the SAHR canister shaft, loosen the jam nut on the threaded rod with a 16 mm wrench.
While using the 15 mm wrench to hold the canister shaft, unscrew the threaded rod using an 8 mm wrench. The rod must be unscrewed approximately 2.5 inches before the cable disconnects.
